titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Improved Benevolent and Protective Order of Elks of the World, Greater Capitol City Lodge, No. 11 (Richmond, Virginia), Records, 1907-1992
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
the Library of Virginia 38098

defitem.label: Funding:
defitem.item: Web version of the finding aid funded in part by a grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle:
Improved Benevolent and Protective Order of Elks of the World, Greater Capitol City Lodge, No. 11 (Richmond, Virginia), Records,
1907-1992
did.physdesc: 3.6 cubic feet; 6 Hollinger boxes and 1 oversize box; box numbers 1-7
did.origination: Improved Benevolent and Protective Order of Elks of the World, Greater Capitol City Lodge, No. 11 (Richmond, Virginia)

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Membership applications are restricted until fifty years after their creation date (i.e. 1952 files may be accessed in the year 2002).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Improved Benevolent and Protective Order of Elks of the World, Greater Capitol City Lodge, No. 11 (Richmond, Va.). Records, 1907-1992. Accession 38098, Organization records collection, Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was given to The Library of Virginia in April 2001 by the Improved Benevolent and Protective Order of Elks of the World, Greater Capitol City Lodge, No. 11, 526 North 2nd Street, Richmond, Virginia 23223.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: The Improved Benevolent and Protective Order of Elks of the World was formed on 28 September 1898 in Cincinnati, Ohio, and is currently the largest African-American fraternal organization in the world. Known for providing social and financial services to member's families upon their untimely death, the organization also developed specific departments to address concerns related to education, health, veteran's affairs, and civil liberties. Members pay monthly dues and burial fund taxes. The Greater Capitol City Lodge was one lodge under the auspices of the Virginia State Association of the I.B.P.O.E.W., which itself was subordinate to the National Association of the I.B.P.O.E.W.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Records, 1907-1992, of the Improved Benevolent and Protective Order of Elks of the World, Greater Capitol City Lodge, No. 11, an African-American fraternal organization located in Richmond, Virginia.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p:
The collection is organized into the following series:
Series I: Correspondence
Series II: Financial records
Series III: Committee reports and files
Series IV: Minutes
Series V: Constitutions, by-laws, and charters
Series VI: Photographs and posters
Series VII: Publications
Series VIII: Membership files

descgrp.head: Separated Materials
descgrp.p: Related memorabilia from this collection was given to the Valentine Museum, 1015 East Clay Street, Richmond, Virginia, 23219.

scopecontent.p: Consists of both financial and non-financial correspondence concerning the organization and its operations. This series has circular letters, memorandums, correspondence with other lodges and organizations, and Department of Alcoholic Beverage Control letters and order of suspension. Circular letters and memorandums concern lodge functions, entertainment, fundraising, committees and departments, lodge and organizational publications, member activities, conventions, and the 29th Anniversary celebration held in 1984.

did.unittitle: Virginia State Department of Alcoholic Beverage Control letters and order of suspension, 1973, 1987-1990, n.d.

scopecontent.p: Contains audits, bank statements, checks, deed of trust, financial reports, invoices, receipts, tax forms, an organizational budget, stock inventories, and stocks and supplies requistions. Receipts specifically concern building repairs and building operations, beer and food purchases, utilities, cable and telephone service, fire and property insurance, and property, occupational, and alcohol taxes.

did.unittitle:
Fire insurance policy and renewal invoices,
1973-1976
Internal Revenue Service tax receipts and correspondence, 1975-1976, 1986

State Corporation Commission registration fee receipts and correspondence,
1987-1990

scopecontent.p: Consists of correspondence and reports concerning the Athletic, Audit, Beauty, Civil Liberties, Disco, Education, House, and 25th Anniversary Committees, and the Grand Exalted Ruler's Office and the Trustee Board.

did.unittitle: Antler Guard creed, orders, and correspondence, 1984 and n.d.
Bingo Committee permit, correspondence and receipts, 1985

District Deputy and Grand Exalted Ruler quarterly reports,
1982-1992
Grand Exalted Ruler's National Convention report, 1986

scopecontent.p: Comprises the minutes, 1940, 1971 and 1988 of the Greater Capitol City Lodge, minutes, 1975, 1981 and 1984, of the Virginia State Association of the I.B.P.O.E.W., and minutes, 1974, of the Daughters of the I.B.P.O.E.W.

did.unittitle: Virginia State Association, I. B. P. O. E. W. annual meeting minutes, 1975
Virginia State Association, I. B. P. O. E. W. annual meeting minutes, 1981
Virginia State Association, I. B. P. O. E. W. annual meeting minutes, 1984
Virginia State Association, Daughters of the I. B. P. O. E. W. annual meeting minutes, 1974

scopecontent.p: Specifically contains constitutions and by-laws, 1970, 1979, 1984, 1986, and organizational charters, 1987-1991, for the I. B. P. O. E. W.; a charter, 1907, for the Daughters of I.B.P.O.E.W., Benjamin Temple; a charter, 1956, for Daughters of I.B.P.O.E.W., Daisy Temple; and a charter, 1940, for Brotherhood of Railway and Steamship Clerks.

did.unittitle: Appointee Club constitution and by-laws, n.d.
Sharon Baptist Church (Richmond, Virginia) constitution and by-laws, 1966
Brotherhood of Railway and Steamship Clerks charter, 1940 (see oversize box 7, folder 3)
Daughters of I. B. P. O. E. W., Daisy Temple, charter, 1956 (see oversize box 7, folder 4)
Daughters of I. B. P. O. E. W., Benjamin Temple, charter, 1907 (see oversize box 7, folder 5)

scopecontent.p: Consists of photographs of the I.B.P.O.E.W. members and building and a poster for the 63rd annual convention of I.B.P.O.E.W.

did.unittitle: 63rd annual convention of I. B. P. O. E. W. (see oversize box 7, folder 6)

scopecontent.p: This series contains publications consisting of a members' guidebook, annual meeting programs, 1980-1981, a souvenir program, 1972, of the Purple Cross Nurses Division of the I.B.P.O.E.W., a history of the I.B.P.O.E.W., copies of the "Elk Informer" newsletter, 1975-1976, copies of "The Spectrum," 1981-1982, annual convention pamphlets, 1979, 1983, memorial exercise programs, 1978-1988, and newspaper clippings.

did.unittitle: "History of I. B. P. O. E. W." by Charles Wesley n.d.
I. B. P. O. E. W. annual convention pamphlets, 1979, 1983
I. B. P. O. E. W. toast song n.d.

Miscellaneous events and memorial exercises programs,
1978-1988
Purple Cross Nurses Division of the I. B. P. O. E. W. health department, 1972
"Residential Adaptive Reuse Issues in Virginia," n.d.
20th Anniversary celebration of the Gospel Baptist Young Adult Choir booklet, 1982
Virginia State Association, I. B. P. O. E. W. annual meeting program, 1980
Virginia State Association, I. B. P. O. E. W. annual meeting program, 1981

Virginia State Association, I. B. P. O. E. W. newsletters,
1984-1991

scopecontent.p: Specifically contains delinquent member lists and notices, membership applications, member burial fund lists, members dues booklets, members dues cards and accounts, member certificates, member name tags, lodges and councils lists, current and former lists of officers, charter member list, membership tests, a lodge list for the Daughters of I.B.P.O.E.W., and membership rolls 1984-1990. There is also members' trial correspondence, duties of unit officers, and correspondence and files pertaining to Scottie Wood.

did.unittitle: Grand Lodge former officers, Exalted Rulers, and charter members n.d.
Past Exalted Rulers Appointee Club member list, n.d.
Virginia State Association list of officers, 1983
Virginia State Association, Daughters of I. B. P. O. E. W. membership roster, n.d.
